result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany K Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Milwaukee County

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Comply with any mental helath / psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Follow through with any assessments, treatments, counseling or any other condition deemed appropriate by the probation agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use by agent WITH Court's permission.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany K Schneider

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brittany K Schneider in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. 

COUNT #1:

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

___ 90 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 0 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR	***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____Follow through with any assesments, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
____Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Probation Agent

COSTS:  $200.00 DNA surcharge + $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 20 days-Non-working hours with standard release conditions, STAYED for use of agent with court permission.
Sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brittany K Schneider in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Attorney Kershek requests a later sentencing date so Defendant can finish class.  Court adjourns for sentencing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brittany K Schneider in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Brittany K Schneider in court with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attrorney Kershek requests an adjournment.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with Walmart Store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Brittany K Schneider in court.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.
